Normality tests
Repeat experiment
```{r}
set.seed(123)
```
generates 1000 variables normally distributed
```{r}
x = rnorm(1000)
```
QQ graphic
```{r}
#run with CTRL + SHIFT + ENTER
qqnorm(x)
#line
qqline(x)
```
Shapiro Test
p-value > 0.5, there is no evidence to confirm the null hypothesis of normally distributed data
```{r}
shapiro.test(x)
```
histogram with density line
```{r}
#run with CRTL+SHIFT+ENTER
hist(x, main="")
par(new=TRUE)
plot(density(x), ylab = "", xlab="", axes = F, lwd = 2.5)
```
non-normally distributed data
```{r}
#install.packages("semTools")
library("semTools")
m = mvrnonnorm(1000, c(1, 2), matrix(c(10, 2, 2, 5), 2, 2), skewness = c(5, 2), kurtosis = c(3,3))

qqnorm(m)
qqline(m)
```

```{r}
shapiro.test(m)
```
```{r}
#run all chunck (CRTL+SHIFT+ENTER)
hist(m, main="")
par(new=TRUE)
plot(density(m), ylab="", xlab="", axes=F, lwd=2.5)
```
